required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of Noninvasive Hemoglobin, Comparison of PVI to Standard Methods, and Validation of Clinical Efficacy of ORI
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of a Pulse Oximetry Based Hemoglobin Measurement System. Comparison of Plethysmographic Variability Index to Standard Methods of Guiding Fluid and Transfusion Management in the Critically Ill Adult Patients. Validation of Clinical Efficacy of ORI for Supplemental Oxygen Titration

brief_summary.textblock: The study goal is to establish the correlation of hemoglobin values determined by the noninvasive pulse oximetry-determined hemoglobin (SpHb) system with hemoglobin as measured by other validated devices. The study will also evaluation oxygen reserve index (ORI) to correlate with partial pressure of oxygen (PaO2), and to evaluate pleth variability index (PVI) with stroke volume variation (SVV) or pulse pressure variation (PPV) values.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of study participation is up to three days.
primary_outcome.description: Accuracy of SpHb will be determined by comparing it to the hemoglobin value obtained from a reference blood sample and calculating the accuracy root mean square (Arms) error value. In order to obtain the Arms value, the blood sample hemoglobin value is subtracted from SpHb value for a number of samples, the average of this difference is computed as the bias. The standard deviation of the differences is computed as the precision. The square root of the sum of the squares of bias and precision is computed as the Arms Error value.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation of PVI Measurement Compared With PPV or SVV
primary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of study participation is up to three days.
primary_outcome.description: Correlation of PVI measurement compared with pulse pressure variation PPV or stroke volume variation (SVV) measurement from arterial catheter

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation of "ORI" With Partial Pressure of Oxygen (PaO2) "PaO2" Measurement From Blood Gas Analysis
primary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of study participation is up to three days.
primary_outcome.description: Concordance will be determined by comparing the trending ability of the Oxygen Reserve Index (ORI) measurement of the sensor with that of Partial Pressure of Oxygen in Blood (PaO2).

arm_group.description: All subjects will be enrolled into the test group and will receive Masimo Pulse CO-Oximeter for measurement of various physiological parameters.

intervention.description: Noninvasive pulse oximeter with various features for measurement of hemoglobin, pleth variability index, and oxygen reserve index

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Admitted into the ICU
- Aged 18 years or older
- Mechanically ventilated
- Arterial line placed
- Vigileo/Flotrac System being used for guidance of fluid management
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Prisoner status
- Extreme hemodynamic instability
- Multiple vasopressors in use with questionable peripheral blood flow
- Lack of appropriate sites for sensor placement
- Patient or patient's legal representative refusal

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

measure.title: Age
measure.population: There were four subjects that did not complete the study.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Noninvasive Pulse Oximetry-determined SpHb Bias
outcome.description: Accuracy of SpHb will be determined by comparing it to the hemoglobin value obtained from a reference blood sample and calculating the accuracy root mean square (Arms) error value. In order to obtain the Arms value, the blood sample hemoglobin value is subtracted from SpHb value for a number of samples, the average of this difference is computed as the bias. The standard deviation of the differences is computed as the precision. The square root of the sum of the squares of bias and precision is computed as the Arms Error value.
outcome.time_frame: Duration of study participation is up to three days.
outcome.population: A total of 12 subjects were excluded from data analysis Subjects were excluded from data analysis for different reasons. Reason 1: Blood sample could not be analyzed because received out of analyzer required time window Reason 2: Sensor data is not available Reason 3: No time matched sensor and blood sample data pair for analysis Reason 4: Reference tHb error. tHb difference >1g/dL between different methods

group.title: Test Group

In order to obtain the Arms value, the blood sample hemoglobin value is subtracted from SpHb value for a number of samples, the average of this difference is computed as the bias. The standard deviation of the differences is computed as the precision. The square root of the sum of the squares of bias and precision is computed as the Arms Error value.
measure.population: A total of 12 subjects were excluded from data analysis Subjects were excluded from data analysis for different reasons. outcome.title: Correlation of PVI Measurement Compared With PPV or SVV
outcome.description: Correlation of PVI measurement compared with pulse pressure variation PPV or stroke volume variation (SVV) measurement from arterial catheter
outcome.time_frame: Duration of study participation is up to three days.
outcome.population: There was no reference SVV or PPV data available for PVI data analysis.

group.title: Test Group
group.description: All subjects will be enrolled into the test group and will receive Masimo Pulse CO-Oximeter for measurement of various physiological parameters. Masimo Pulse CO-Oximeter: Noninvasive pulse oximeter with various features for measurement of hemoglobin, pleth variability index, and oxygen reserve index

measure.title: Correlation of PVI Measurement Compared With PPV or SVV
measure.description: Correlation of PVI measurement compared with pulse pressure variation PPV or stroke volume variation (SVV) measurement from arterial catheter
measure.population: There was no reference SVV or PPV data available for PVI data analysis.

outcome.title: Correlation of "ORI" With Partial Pressure of Oxygen (PaO2) "PaO2" Measurement From Blood Gas Analysis
outcome.description: Concordance will be determined by comparing the trending ability of the Oxygen Reserve Index (ORI) measurement of the sensor with that of Partial Pressure of Oxygen in Blood (PaO2).
outcome.time_frame: Duration of study participation is up to three days.
outcome.population: Data from 8 subjects were obtained. At least two samples per subject are required to compare ORI trending ability; however, only 1 sample was obtained from each subject which precluded conduct of any data analysis.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were monitored throughout study duration, which was up to three days.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
